articles.description: Beginning Jan. 1, employers will no longer be required to give employees who become sick with COVID-19 two weeks of paid leave.
articles.content:
Beginning Jan. 1, employers will no longer be required to give employees who become sick with COVID-19 two weeks of paid leave.

articles.title: Paycheck Protection Program returns with $285 billion, and there's still room for fraud - CBS News
articles.description: News organizations, high-end co-ops and talent agents will have a better shot at getting a PPP loan in round three.
